title: Romantic Valentine prompt page with evasive No button and Yes meme reveal

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic Valentine prompt UI that asks the user (in English) to be the author’s Valentine, using a pink-and-white color scheme and a simple, centered layout optimized for iPad Chrome.

quotes: Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend. The page should be simple, romantic-themed, and have only one purpose: to ask her to be my Valentine.
The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme and be fully interactive ... so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: App loads to a single screen with one clear question asking to be the author’s Valentine (English text).
Visual styling is consistently pink/white and romantic-themed.
Layout is responsive and usable on iPad Chrome in both portrait and landscape (no horizontal scrolling).

requirements.text: Implement two on-screen options: “Yes” and “No”. The “No” option must move away when the user attempts to interact with it so that it is effectively not clickable.

quotes: There should be two options: Yes or No. When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: Both “Yes” and “No” controls are visible on initial load.
On pointer hover/enter over “No”, the “No” control relocates to a different position within the visible viewport/container.
On touch devices (iPad), attempting to tap “No” causes it to move away (e.g., on touchstart/pointerdown), preventing a successful click.
The “No” control never moves off-screen; it remains visible but evasive.

requirements.text: When the user clicks/taps “Yes”, replace the prompt/options with a reveal state that displays a meme image and the exact message: “That’s the best decision you’ve ever made❤️”.

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her “That’s the best decision you’ve ever made❤️”.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping “Yes” transitions the UI to a new state without requiring page reload.
The reveal state shows the meme image and the exact text: “That’s the best decision you’ve ever made❤️”.
The original “Yes/No” options are no longer shown after the “Yes” selection.

requirements.text: Add the required generated meme image to the app as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it in the “Yes” reveal state.

quotes: show her a meme image telling her “That’s the best decision you’ve ever made❤️”.

acceptanceCriteria: The generated image file exists at frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme.dim_1200x1200.png.
The frontend loads and displays the image from static assets (not via backend).
Image scales appropriately on iPad and smaller screens (no overflow/cropping of the message).

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Frontend must be implemented within the provided React + TypeScript + Tailwind template (do not add a separate standalone HTML file).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not add new backend functionality unless required (this feature should be frontend-only).
nonGoals: Internet Identity authentication or any user accounts.
Sharing, emailing, or social posting features.
Any additional pages or app sections beyond the single Valentine prompt and the Yes reveal state.

required: Square meme-style romantic image with the text “That’s the best decision you’ve ever made❤️” in the design (valentine-meme.dim_1200x1200.png)
